result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 01-04-2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 7 days in jail, for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Simpson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher J Simpson in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:   FINE:  $347.50-to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 1/4/16, altrernate 7 days jail if not paid.

Defendant Christopher J Simpson in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests an adjourned date for plea and sentencing.  Defendant is still in treatment and needs to complete to accept state's offer.  State does not object to request.  Court takes off jury trial and adjourns for plea and sentence.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury trial - 12 person on October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Christopher J Simpson did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco states that Defendant is trying to obtain some treatment that needs approval from the state.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Christopher J Simpson did not appear.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests an adjournment so Defendant can obtain treatment.   Court adjourns. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
to appear filed by Attorney Katie Bricco

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Christopher J Simpson did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests an adjourned as she was just assigned this case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Christopher J Simpson in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
